channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pinterest now lets you dial down the AI slop as human-powered social media faces an existential moment

item.title: Meet the Resy CMO using data to shape your next great meal
item.description: Resy is pursuing a marketing strategy that turns restaurant data into cultural currency.

item.title: 5 Ways to Build Connection That Impacts Learning
item.description: Transform your employee training by leveraging the power of microlearning and authentic connection.

item.title: Federal student loans are disappearing—but only for borrowers who did this one thing

item.title: How Customs Brokers Are Using AI to Cut Tariff Costs
item.description: A growing number of AI tools now help importers reduce new tax levels while improving supply chain efficiencies.

item.title: These New AI Features Could Cut Hours of Work From Your Marketing and Presentations
item.description: Anthropic’s latest announcements show how Claude is designed to be a helpful coworker. It can even connect to Microsoft 365.

item.title: This 26-year-old’s TikTok-like AI app makes playful, creative short videos from just a few words—it’s built for Gen Z
item.description: Pika, Demi Guo's fast-growing AI video app, is taking on Meta’s Vibes and OpenAI’s Sora by turning quick prompts and selfies into shareable clips.

item.title: LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault sees wealth skyrocket by $19 billion overnight after months of bleeding billions as shoppers trade designer bags for luxury vacations

item.title: Are You Part of Your Customer Demographic?
item.description: It’s a big marketing advantage but you have to rethink scalability.

item.title: California just made insulin affordable—without Big Pharma’s help
item.description: One of the most vital drugs with a high price tag will get dramatically more affordable next year—if you live in California. California will start sel...

item.title: The protein craze is heavy metal, literally: bombshell investigation finds unsafe lead amounts in two-thirds of top powders for sale
item.description: Paris Martineau said Consumer Reports found “concerning levels” of heavy metals in a 2010 investigation, but the risks have been growing ever since.

item.title: Why Stress Testing Teams for Readiness Helps You Win
item.description: Leaders should teach their teams how to excel under pressure.

item.title: Ron Conway skewers Mark Benioff in board resignation after 25 years: ‘I now barely recognize the person I have so long admired’
item.description: "San Francisco does not need a federal invasion because you don’t like paying for extra security for Dreamforce," Conway said.
